words.defineEn: (of law enforcement agencies) to take a person away because they believe that they have done something illegal
words.defineVi: (của các cơ quan thực thi pháp luật) để đưa một người đi vì họ tin rằng họ đã làm điều gì đó bất hợp pháp

examples: The film caught a cold over the outstanding debt.
A vase on a side table caught his eye.
The new law caught them unawares.
He caught a glimpse of his reflection in the glass.
As she turned back, a movement across the lawn caught her eye.
words.defineEn: to stop and hold an object that is moving through the air by hands
words.defineVi: để dừng lại và giữ một đối tượng đang di chuyển trong không khí bằng tay

examples: To bring charges/legal action/proceedings against somebody.
First of all, they're charging an arm and a leg.
I was put in charge of the office.
The charges against the suspect will come up in court tomorrow.
Who put Tony in charge of the accounts?
words.defineEn: to officially accuse someone of an offense
words.defineVi: để chính thức cáo buộc một ai đó của một hành vi phạm tội

examples: Researchers are investigating the potential uses of gulfweed as a sustainable resourc.
To give himself an edge, he investigated anyone who might be a threat to him.
We tried to investigate but met a wall of silence.
They rely on the police to investigate crimes and bring criminals to justice.
We have confidence in the police's ability to investigate and solve crimes.
words.defineEn: to try to find the truth about a crime, accident, etc. by carefully examining its facts
words.defineVi: cố gắng tìm ra sự thật về một tội ác, tai nạn, v.v. bằng cách xem xét cẩn thận các sự kiện của nó

examples: The question requires critical thinking and analysis.
The quiz consisted of multiple-choice questions.
The book raises many important questions.
The waiter patiently answered our questions about the ingredients in the dish.
Can I ask a question?
words.defineEn: to have or express uncertainty about something
words.defineVi: để có hoặc bày tỏ sự không chắc chắn về một cái gì đó

examples: Millions of people followed the trial on TV.
The trial was swiftly brought to an end.
In a criminal trial the standard of proof is beyond the reasonable doubt.
The trial has run its course, and the verdict will be announced tomorrow.
The company sent out a trial balloon by leaking a rumor about a new product to test customer interest before investing in its development.
words.defineEn: a legal process examining the evidence of a case in court by a judge and jury and deciding if the accused is guilty
words.defineVi: một quy trình pháp lý kiểm tra bằng chứng của một vụ án tại tòa án bởi một thẩm phán và bồi thẩm đoàn và quyết định xem bị cáo có tội hay không

words.defineEn: one or multiple people who are believed to have committed a crime in a law court
words.defineVi: một hoặc nhiều người được cho là đã phạm tội tại tòa án luật

words.defineEn: found to be not guilty of an illegal act in a law court
words.defineVi: được cho là không có tội đối với một hành vi bất hợp pháp tại tòa án luật

examples: The lawyer presented the right argument in court.
The courts decided in favor of the New York claimants.
The court found in her favor.
The charges against the suspect will come up in court tomorrow.
The court held that such conduct violated the statute.
words.defineEn: the group of people in a court including the judge and the jury
words.defineVi: nhóm người trong một tòa án bao gồm thẩm phán và bồi thẩm đoàn

examples: The police searched the suspect's house for evidence.
Evidence of their relationship exists in the form of a series of letters.
He presented a false document as evidence in the court case.
This latest evidence could be the final nail in the coffin for Jackson's case.
This evidence proves that the senator was part of the conspiracy.
words.defineEn: a statement, document, or object that is used in a law court for establishing facts
words.defineVi: một tuyên bố, tài liệu, hoặc đối tượng được sử dụng trong một tòa án pháp luật để thiết lập sự kiện

examples: I was feeling guilty.
Judging by the evidence presented in court, the defendant is clearly guilty.
He looks guilty as sin, yes, but he insists he's innocent.
I hope this guilty verdict puts that rat of a CEO in his place.
Many judges admitted that the Dodge was their guilty pleasure out of our field.
words.defineEn: at fault for an illegal act or something bad that has happened
words.defineVi: có lỗi vì một hành động bất hợp pháp hoặc điều gì đó tồi tệ đã xảy ra

examples: Thousands of innocents were put to the sword.
If we go to war, innocent lives will be put at risk.
If we go to war, innocent lives will be put at risk.
By putting innocent lives at risk?
The court established, beyond any reasonable doubt, that the man was innocent.
words.defineEn: not having done a crime or something wrong
words.defineVi: không làm một tội ác hoặc một cái gì đó sai trái

examples: The judge will have the last word on the divorce agreement.
The judge allowed my claim.
The judge brought his hammer down on the table.
The judge stood firm in her ruling.
People often judge a book by its cover without reading the contents.
words.defineEn: the official in charge of a court who decides on legal matters
words.defineVi: quan chức phụ trách tòa án quyết định các vấn đề pháp lý

examples: The jury is still out as concerns the location of the new station.
The case was tried before a jury.
The jury was unable to reach a verdict.
The case will be decided by a jury.
Today the jury began to hear the evidence.
words.defineEn: a group of twelve citizens, who listen to the details of a case in the court of law in order to decide the guiltiness or innocence of a defendant
words.defineVi: một nhóm gồm mười hai công dân, những người lắng nghe các chi tiết của một vụ án tại tòa án để quyết định sự có tội hay vô tội của bị cáo

examples: In a criminal trial the standard of proof is beyond the reasonable doubt.
During a debate, each debater has the burden of proof to support their arguments and convince the audience of their position.
In a criminal trial, the prosecution bears the burden of proof to demonstrate the guilt of the accused beyond a reasonable doubt.
When making an argument or presenting a case, it is important to provide strong evidence to support your claims and carry the burden of proof.
The job candidate's resume looked impressive, but the proof of the pudding is in the eating, and we need to see how well they perform in a real work setting.
words.defineEn: information or evidence that proves the truth or existence of something
words.defineVi: thông tin hoặc bằng chứng chứng minh sự thật hoặc sự tồn tại của một cái gì đó

examples: A sentence always starts with a capital letter.
What does this sentence mean?
He served an 18-month sentence for theft.
He is serving a ten-year jail sentence.
Read me that last sentence again.
words.defineEn: to officially state the punishment of someone found guilty in a court of law
words.defineVi: để chính thức tuyên bố hình phạt của một ai đó bị kết tội trong một tòa án của pháp luật

examples: I gave my verdict.
The jury was unable to reach a verdict.
I hope this guilty verdict puts that rat of a CEO in his place.
The trial has run its course, and the verdict will be announced tomorrow.
Everyone had been holding their breath, waiting for the verdict.
words.defineEn: an official decision made by the jury in a court after the legal proceedings
words.defineVi: một quyết định chính thức được đưa ra bởi bồi thẩm đoàn tại tòa án sau thủ tục pháp lý
